Belgium: Tax resistance by Guilds of Brussels.
Burma: English East India Company sends a representative to Pegu
China: Battle of Sarhu: The last of four Ming armies was destroyed during a retreat from a punitive expedition against Nurhaci and the later Jin. Its commander Li Rubai committed suicide
Indinesia: Jan Pieterszoon Coen appointed Governor-General of the VOC who would show he had no scruples about using brute force to establish the VOC on a firm footing.
Coen, backed by a force of nineteen ships, storms the Jayakarta driving out the Banten forces, and from the ashes of Jayakarta, establishes Batavia as the VOC headquarters.
Philippine: University of Santo Tomas, then known as Colegio de Nuestra Señora del Santissimo Rosario, recognized by the Holy See.
Russia: Feodor Romanov, Michael's father, was released from Polish prison and allowed to return to Muscovy.
USA: Slavery was introduced to the Colony of Virginia.
